alert.note: Alert for Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 10:45PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Dale County through 1115 PM CST... At 1045 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ozark, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ozark, Fort Rucker, Skipperville, Echo, Dill, Roberts Crossroads, Mabson, Arguta, Ewell, Beamon, Browns Crossroads, Dale County Lake, Goldberg Field, Marley Hill, Blackwell Field A/p, Dillard and Ward Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
